CatDescriptText: Mr. Henry C. Irving, 7212 Agnes Street, Swissvale, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 7, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think it justifiable for residents to "put the finger" (notify law enforcement officers) on rackets if they exist in their respective communities?" Answer reads: "No, because I think that residents will be endangering themselves. The people are paying for rackets to be stopped by the police force and they should be stopped by the polices.  It just wouldn't make sense for me to got and and 'put the finger' on a racket.  I might get my brains blown out."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Henry C. Irving, wearing light colored fedora, eyeglasses, thin moustache, dark herringbone jacket, and patterned sweater, standing next to utility pole on herringbone patterned brick sidewalk, buildings with fire escapes and one inscribed "Half Bro..." in background
